intro: Eleocharis parvula f. spongiosa, commonly known as the spongy spike-rush, is a flowering plant species belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is characterized by its dense, spongy inflorescence, which gives it its common name. The plant typically grows in wetland environments, such as marshes and shallow water areas. Its small, spike-like clusters of flowers are usually pale green to brown in color. Eleocharis parvula f. spongiosa plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various aquatic organisms.
